      • handler

        javafx.event.EventHandler handler
        This creates the button labels and uses a switch for buttons being used. Depending on the button pressed, the switch will use the compute() method which handles for any of the math operations being used and will also update the text field at the top of the calculator

    • Constructor Detail

      • JavaFXCalculator

        public JavaFXCalculator()

    • Method Detail

      • compute

        private void compute()
        This method performs the math operations of the one that the user chooses

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        This creates the calculator itself. It creates the text fields and displays one at the top and bottom. It creates rows and columns in a GridPane for the buttons to be placed in at equal width. The buttons are then placed with their labels using a for loop and inside their is a switch giving the buttons their colors.
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Parameters:
        args - launches the calculator
